{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.01814v1", "title": "Energy Density Functional of Confined Quarks: an Improved Ansatz", "summary": "Density Functional Theory (DFT) is a robust framework for modeling
interacting many-body systems, including the equation of state (EoS) of dense
matter. Many models, however, rely on energy functionals based on assumptions
that have not been rigorously validated. We critically analyze a commonly used
ansatz for confinement, where the energy functional scales with density as $U
\propto n^{\frac{2}{3}}$ . Our findings, derived from a systematic non-local
energy functional, reveal that this scaling does not capture the dynamics of
confinement. Instead, the energy functional evolves from $n^2$ at low densities
to $n$ at high densities, governed by an infrared cutoff. These results suggest
that models relying on such assumptions should be revisited to ensure more
reliable EoS construction.", "main_category": "nucl-th", "categories": "nucl-th,astro-ph.HE,hep-ph,hep-th", "published": "2025-04-02T15:20:03Z"}
